Initial priority is high-resolution structural imaging to confirm a rostral midbrain lesion, define its extent, and distinguish demyelinating, vascular, and neoplastic causes. Vascular imaging helps detect basilar or superior cerebellar artery disease. Cerebrospinal fluid analysis and targeted blood tests assess for demyelinating, autoimmune, inflammatory, metabolic, and infectious aetiologies. Systemic imaging screens for malignancy or sarcoidosis in suspected paraneoplastic or granulomatous disease. Evoked potentials can demonstrate dissemination in space and time if multiple sclerosis is suspected.
